eu.amidst.core.variables

Interface Assignment

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DataInstance
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataInstanceImpl, HashMapAssignment, MissingAssignment

    public interface Assignment
    This interface defines a collection of assignments to variables.

    I.e. "(A=0.1, B = True)", assuming A is continuous variable and B a binary variable.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getValue(Variable var)
      This method return the value assigned to a given variable
      java.util.Set<Variable> getVariables()
      This method returns the set of variables contained in the assignment.
      default java.lang.String outputString()
      This method contains a default implementation of a "toString()" method.
      void setValue(Variable var, double value)
      This method set the value assigned to a variable.

    • Method Detail

      • getValue

        double getValue(Variable var)
        This method return the value assigned to a given variable
        Parameters:
        var, - the Variable object we want to query
        Returns:
        The assigned value to the given variable. Returns a Double.NaN if the variable is not included in the assignment.

      • getVariables

        java.util.Set<Variable> getVariables()
        This method returns the set of variables contained in the assignment.
        Returns:
        A valide Set object

      • outputString

        default java.lang.String outputString()
        This method contains a default implementation of a "toString()" method. It produces a String detailed all the variable-value assignments stored in the object. E.g., {A=0, B=1.7}.
        Returns:
        A String object starting with "{" and endind with "}".

      • setValue

        void setValue(Variable var,
              double value)
        This method set the value assigned to a variable. If the value is already include, then the value is updated accordingly.
        Parameters:
        var, - the Variable object we want to assign
        value, - the assigned value
